instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic on Catalina after Hardware dGPU bypass
threads.message:
Hi Fam, good morning.

I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which, after <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> resolder, replacement, and all sorts of possibilities, was not completing the boot on any system, neither from internal or external drives.

So, I run the jumpers to bypass the dGPU and it looked perfect until I tried to run the Catalina install and it simply didn't finish, giving a Kernel Panic a little before the installation end.

I tried to install Mojave, and all was perfect including the system security updates. 

Any ideas?

BTW, I didn't remove the 2 inductors the bypass step3) ...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic on Catalina after Hardware dGPU bypass
threads.message:
What do you expect installing Catalina in such old machine?
Which also have GPU issue...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic on Catalina after Hardware dGPU bypass
threads.message:
You should disable power going to the GPU one way or another so that it doesn't try to initialize.
A random kernel panic can happen so maybe it was just bad luck. If it does it everytime you should run Memtest and try on another storage device. Also if you are installing from USB drive, try a different one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic on Catalina after Hardware dGPU bypass
threads.message:
[QUOTE="piernov, post: 72232, member: 1057"]
You should disable power going to the GPU one way or another so that it doesn't try to initialize.
A random kernel panic can happen so maybe it was just bad luck. If it does it everytime you should run Memtest and try on another storage device. Also if you are installing from USB drive, try a different one.
[/QUOTE]


Thanks, fam... after cut dGPU power all went well...

Issue solved, happy customer :)
